definition: to totally stop doing something/to reform one's ways
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: I have washed my hands of the whole sordid business .
sentences.chinese: 我已经彻底洗手不干所有的肮脏的勾当了。

sentences.english: After being in the used car business for 40 years, Harry finally called it quits.
sentences.chinese: 做了40年旧车买卖后，哈利终于洗手不干了。

sentences.english: I've washed my hands of the whole sordid business.
sentences.chinese: 我已经洗手不干那种肮脏的勾当了。

sentences.english: I decided to pack it in and move to New York.
sentences.chinese: 我决定洗手不干，迁居纽约。
毕竟，我已经准备洗手不干了。

sentences.english: I told you I was flinging in my hand. Now didn't I?
sentences.chinese: 我告诉过你我洗手不干了，你怎么又来找我？

sentences.english: He's gev em up now for religion;
sentences.chinese: 他现在洗手不干了，开始相信宗教。

sentences.english: If Christ has not been raised, we might as well throw in the towel.
sentences.chinese: 如果基督没有复活，我们大可洗手不干。

sentences.english: Is it really so hard for a wrongdoer to wash his hands of illegal activities?
sentences.chinese: 一个罪犯对违法之事洗手不干真的有那么难吗？

definition: lit. to wash one's hands in a gold basin (idiom)/fig. to abandon the life of an outlaw
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
(of a villain) to do the dirty on another villain
one's old profession/trade of one's forebears
to lose everything one invested (idiom)/to lose one's shirt
